definition: to absorb/to draw (a lesson, insight etc)/to assimilate
to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
to draw a lesson (from a setback)

sentences.english: The first lesson learned is that lessons can be learned.
sentences.chinese: 第一個條件是我們可以吸取經驗教訓。

sentences.english: And I take from all these areas.
sentences.chinese: 我從所有這些領域中吸取內容。

sentences.english: Draw lessons from mistake,don't make same mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 從錯誤中吸取教訓，不要重犯舊錯。

sentences.english: The bee sucks honey out of the bitterest flowers.
sentences.chinese: 蜜蜂是從最苦的花朵中吸取花蜜。

sentences.english: But we have learned from these efforts.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我們從中吸取了教訓。

sentences.english: If necessary, suction off the droplets using an eyedropper or syringe.
sentences.chinese: 如有需要，用眼藥水瓶或注射器吸取液滴。

sentences.english: Our focus now should bein drawing lessons.
sentences.chinese: 我們現在的重點應當是吸取教訓。

sentences.english: Will solve the postal savings funds drawn from the rural areas over the issue.
sentences.chinese: 也就解決了郵政儲蓄從農村過度吸取資金的問題。

sentences.english: I'll extract wholesome medicines from Mrs Dean's bitter herbs;
sentences.chinese: 我要從丁太太的苦藥草裏吸取有益的藥品。

sentences.english: One ought to draw the positive and negative historical lessons.
sentences.chinese: 大家應當吸取正反兩面的歷史教訓。

sentences.english: Ironically, a dry scalp can produce more oil which then gets in the hair.
sentences.chinese: 乾性頭皮會從頭髮中吸取油脂，從而更易出油。

sentences.english: A failure is a man who has blundered, but is not able to cash in on the experience. -(Elbert Hubbard)
sentences.chinese: 失敗者是犯了錯誤而不能從中吸取教訓的人。

sentences.english: Our basketball team learned its lesson.
sentences.chinese: 我們的籃球隊吸取了教訓。

sentences.english: Finally, Prasong kill friction dove, learned all his mana.
sentences.chinese: 最後，巴頌殺死摩鳩，吸取了他全部法力。

sentences.english: He absorbed knowledge as a blotter does ink.
sentences.chinese: 他像吸水紙吸墨水一般吸取知識。

sentences.english: As we do so, we must learn the lessons of the past.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，我們必須從以往工作中吸取經驗教訓。

definition: to take in/to absorb/to admit/to accept
to draw a lesson (from a setback)
to imbue with/to inculcate/to instill into/to teach/to impart/to channel water to another place
to condense/to coagulate/coacervation (i.e. form tiny droplets)/aggregation/coherent
best feature/most important part of an object/quintessence/essence/soul
